steps.title: Open the LaTeX website in your internet browser.
steps.content: Open the LaTeX website in your internet browser. Type https://www.latex-project.org into the address bar, and press ⏎ Return on your keyboard.

steps.title: Click the Get tab.
steps.content: Click the Get tab. This button is on a tab bar at the top of the page, below the Latex Project logo.

steps.title: Click the blue MiKTeX link under the Windows heading.
steps.content: Click the blue MiKTeX link under the Windows heading. This will open the MiKTeX website on a new page. Alternatively, you can click and install one of the other recommended TeX packages in this section. All the recommendations here include LaTeX.

steps.title: Click the Downloads tab.
steps.content: Click the Downloads tab. This button is on a yellow tab bar at the top. It will open the download page.

steps.title: Click the blue Download button.
steps.content: Click the blue Download button. This button is at the bottom of the page. It will download the installer to your computer's default folder for downloads. If you're prompted, select a download location for the installer.

steps.title: Double-click the "basic-miktex.exe" installer file on your computer.
steps.content: Double-click the "basic-miktex.exe" installer file on your computer. This will launch the installation wizard in a new window.

steps.title: Check the "I accept the MiKTeX copying conditions" box.
steps.content: Check the "I accept the MiKTeX copying conditions" box. You have to accept the software terms in order to proceed with the install.

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . This will take you to the next step.

steps.title: Select an option on the Installation Scope step.
steps.content: Select an option on the Installation Scope step. You can choose to install the program for the current user on this computer or all the users. Click Next to proceed.

steps.title: Click Browse to change installation location (optional).
steps.content: Click Browse to change installation location (optional). If you want to select a different install location, click this button, and choose where you want to install the software. Click Next to confirm install location and proceed.

steps.title: Select your paper type in the "Preferred paper" drop-down.
steps.content: Select your paper type in the "Preferred paper" drop-down. Click the drop-down menu, and select the type of paper (A4, Letter, Legal etc) you prefer.

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . This will confirm your installation settings, and allow you to review your preferences before starting the install.

steps.title: Click the Start button.
steps.content: Click the Start button. It's on the bottom-right corner of the install window. This will start the software installation on your computer. You can track the installation on a green progress bar here.

steps.title: Click the Close button.
steps.content: Click the Close button. When your installation is finished, click this button to close the installation wizard.

steps.title: Open the Latex website in your internet browser.
steps.content: Open the Latex website in your internet browser. Type https://www.latex-project.org into the address bar, and press ⏎ Return on your keyboard.

steps.title: Click the Get tab.
steps.content: Click the Get tab. It's on a tab bar at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click MacTeX under the Mac OS heading.
steps.content: Click MacTeX under the Mac OS heading. This will open the official MacTeX distribution page. Alternatively, you can get the MiKTeX Mac version at https://miktex.org/download .

steps.title: Click the blue MacTeX Download link.
steps.content: Click the blue MacTeX Download link. This will take you to the download page.

steps.title: Click the blue MacTeX.pkg link.
steps.content: Click the blue MacTeX.pkg link. This will download the installation file to your computer's Downloads folder.

steps.title: Double-click the "MacTex.pkg" file on your computer.
steps.content: Double-click the "MacTex.pkg" file on your computer. This will start the installation wizard.

steps.title: Click Next in the installation wizard.
steps.content: Click Next in the installation wizard. This button is in the lower-right corner of the installer window. Follow the installer's steps, and hit Next a few times until you see the Install button.

steps.title: Click the Install button.
steps.content: Click the Install button. When you're on the "Installation Type" step in the installer, click the Install button to install the program on your Mac.

steps.title: Click the Close button.
steps.content: Click the Close button. You'll see a message saying "Success" when your installation is complete. Click this button to quit the installer.

steps.title: Open the MiKTeX website in your internet browser.
steps.content: Open the MiKTeX website in your internet browser. Type https://miktex.org/download into the address bar, and press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard. Alternatively, you can download TeX Live at https://www.tug.org/texlive . This version also includes LaTeX.

steps.title: Click the Downloads tab at the top.
steps.content: Click the Downloads tab at the top. You can find it on a yellow tab bar at the top of the page. It will open the available downloads on a new page.

steps.title: Click the Linux tab under the "Getting MiKTeX" heading.
steps.content: Click the Linux tab under the "Getting MiKTeX" heading. You can find the installation command prompts for different Linux versions here.

steps.title: Select your Linux version under the "Install on Linux" heading.
steps.content: Select your Linux version under the "Install on Linux" heading. You can select Ubuntu , Mint , Debian , Fedora or OpenSUSE .

steps.title: Open the Terminal on your Linux computer.
steps.content: Open the Terminal on your Linux computer. You can use the Terminal to run commands, and install applications on your computer.

steps.title: Copy the "Register GPG key" command from the MiKTeX website.
steps.content: Copy the "Register GPG key" command from the MiKTeX website. You can find the correct Terminal command for your Linux version on the Downloads page.

steps.title: Paste the "Register GPG key" command to Terminal.
steps.content: Paste the "Register GPG key" command to Terminal. You can run this command in Terminal on your computer, and register the GPG key required to install the software.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard. This will run the command, and register the required GPG key.

steps.title: Copy the "Register installation source" command from the website.
steps.content: Copy the "Register installation source" command from the website. You can find it below the "Register GPG key" command on the MiKTeX Downloads page.

steps.title: Paste and run the copied command in Terminal.
steps.content: Paste and run the copied command in Terminal. This will register the installation package source on your system. Press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return to run the command.

steps.title: Copy the "Install MiKTeX" commands from the MiKTeX website.
steps.content: Copy the "Install MiKTeX" commands from the MiKTeX website. This will install MiKTeX and all the LaTeX components on your computer. You can find this section at the bottom of the Downloads page.

steps.title: Paste and run the "Install MiKTeX" commands in Terminal.
steps.content: Paste and run the "Install MiKTeX" commands in Terminal. This will install the MiKTeX package on your computer, including all the LaTex components. Press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return to run the command.

steps.title: Type and run miktexsetup finish in Terminal.
steps.content: Type and run miktexsetup finish in Terminal. This command will finish your TeX installation with all the LaTeX files and documents. If you want to finish with a shared (system-wide) TeX installation, use sudo miktexsetup --shared=yes finish instead.
